attachments.title: Software Carpentry lessons with Julia
attachments.text: Software Carpentry is a project to teach basics of programming in the context of research computing. The target audience includes both students and researchers. The current curriculum includes the use of Unix shell, version control with Git, and some lessons with Python and R. To be clear, these lessons arenâ€™t meant to be in any way exhaustive and the programming language used during the lessons is more a mean through which to deliver to attendees good programming practices. A few people are...
